title: >>> At the EDGE
body_text:
The Next Big Thing
The top of the mountain will be reached once again with the forthcoming event, DODGEBALL 40. Some categories for the awards are being released right here, right now!
> The Classics: "Most Intense" and "Powerhouse Thrower" Awards
> The secret award that was not given out at DODGEBALL 30
> A brand new award abbreviated "W.W.W."
Obviously, plenty more awards will be included in the celebration of DODGEBALL 40.
For now, feast your eyes on the 3-hour plus journey known as DODGEBALL 39 ...
Recording "Artists"
> Attendance: 29
> Biggest Returns:
Mark Entwistle (Last played at DODGEBALL TWENTY-TWO)
Glen Binger (Last played at DODGEBALL XXVIII)
Todd Binger (Last played at DODGEBALL XXVIII)
> New Players: (1) Will Colucci
> DODGEBALL 39 marked the first time an attendance was the exact same as the event that preceded it. DODGEBALL 38 also had an attendance of 29.
> Joe Kelly and Ryan Letsche were the event’s captains. Both were looking to keep their undefeated streaks alive after successful first tries as captains.
> DODGEBALL 39 featured more dodge balls in use than any other event in history. During several games, there were a good 10+ at one time (special thanks to both Kevin Megill and Justin Pierce).
> In regards to the "Patterns" in the post entitled "One Step Closer" on May 10th, Kevin Adams was the only player to miss DODGEBALL 39 out of the list of players to never miss a "nine" event. John Watters did not play at DODGEBALL 39 so his "perfect" record still stands.
> Following the conclusion of the main match, Steve Adams brought along a new game he called "The Kevin Megill Memorial". To the public, it can be accurately referred to as a "Dodgeball Battle Royal", in which every player is on their own "team", running around trying to eliminate other players using one side of three tennis courts. Congratulations are in order to John Tronolone for winning the first of these intense contests.
"2 for 2": The Captains Battle
Joe Kelly
- Debuted at D-DAY VI
- Captain at DODGEBALL 38; defeated Sara DeCuir.
Ryan Letsche
- Debuted at DODGEBALL 15
- Captain at DODGEBALL 18; defeated Bill Plantz.
Games moved swiftly and quick, mainly due in part to the number of dodge balls in play. But wise picks kept Joe Kelly undefeated when at the end of night, the score read 7 to 3. Ryan's wins came very late in the evening, much too late for a comeback. Joe not only won his second match, but his second consecutive match.
Ready for the Main Event?
One has to give credit to Dan Spengeman for outlasting many of his teammates and opponents during numerous games. His quick feet and superb blocking kept him in games longer than most.
It would be a sin to not include Diana DiBuccio, as she too played an all-around great game, also outlasting many on the court.
Todd Binger, who only played one other time (XXVIII), perhaps surprised many with natural abilities of catching and throwing.
Valerie Winston once again showed to all that she is never to be overlooked, eliminating by the masses using her very sneaky approach to the line.
The Future on the Road to 50!
The entire first half of "Season V":
DODGEBALL 41: Saturday, May 27th (6:30pm, WHS)
DODGEBALL 42: Sunday, June 4th (3pm, ORP)
DODGEBALL 43: Sunday, June 11th (3pm, ORP)
DODGEBALL 44: Saturday, June 17th (6:30pm, WHS)
DODGEBALL 45: Saturday, June 24th (6:30pm, WHS)
......
DODGEBALL 50: Sunday, July 30th (1pm: ORP)
As always, the schedule can be altered. If you have a birthday on one of the dates above and would like an event moved, let John Tronolone know as soon as possible so that the change can be made.
"Season 4" comes to a close this coming Saturday night at Wall High School. Start time for DODGEBALL 40 is at
6pm
.
